articles.description: While the gatherings have defied social distancing guidelines, Multnomah County COVID-19 case investigators say there have been no outbreaks of the virus linked to Portland’s ongoing protests.
articles.content: Portlands protests against racism and police brutality have continued almost daily since May, drawing crowds of hundreds and sometimes thousands of people together through the summer and fall, even a… [+4965 chars]

articles.title: New blood test may be able to detect 50 types of cancer - KCCI Des Moines
articles.description: The simple blood test may detect more than 50 types of cancer and could help thousands of people by allowing the disease to be treated more successfully at an earlier stage.
articles.content:
Video above: Scientists build stealth virus that could cure cancer
The U.K.'s National Health Service (NHS) will pilot a simple blood test that may detect more than 50 types of cancer and could help… [+3994 chars]

articles.title: COVID-19 Cases In US Pass 13 Million Amid Fears Of Post-Thanksgiving Spike | TODAY - TODAY

articles.author: By Faith Karimi, CNN
articles.title: Some phones can send push alerts to users who were near those who tested positive for COVID-19 - KABC-TV
articles.description: Thanks to technology available on Apple and Google phones, you can now get pop-up notifications in some states if you were close to someone who later tested positive for COVID-19. The alerts come via state health department apps that use Bluetooth.
articles.content: NEW YORK -- As new coronavirus cases explode nationwide, health officials are turning to cell phones to help slow the spread of infections.Thanks to technology available on Apple and Google phones, y… [+6673 chars]

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.title: UK testing error wrongly tells 1,300 people they have coronavirus - Reuters
articles.description: Over 1,300 people in Britain were inaccurately informed they were infected with coronavirus after a laboratory error at the government's NHS Test and Trace system, the Department of Health and Social Care told Reuters on Saturday.
articles.content: (Reuters) - Over 1,300 people in Britain were inaccurately informed they were infected with coronavirus after a laboratory error at the governments NHS Test and Trace system, the Department of Health… [+1747 chars]
